visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a line chart with the following specifications: Chart type: line, Chart title: 'Monthly Average Temperature', Axes and labels styling: X-axis labels should be in blue color with a font size of 12px, Y-axis labels should be in green color with a font size of 14px, Data series: Series name 'Temperature' with data [29.9, 71.5, 106.4, 129.2, 144.0, 176.0, 135.6, 148.5, 216.4, 194.1, 95.6, 54.4], Custom colors: Use a gradient color for the line series starting from light blue to dark blue, Additional configurations: Set chart margins to 50px on all sides, add a legend at the bottom of the chart, and set the chart background to a light gray color.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object configures a line chart with a specified width of 300px and a light gray background. The chart title is set to 'Monthly Average Temperature'. The X-axis labels are styled in blue with a font size of 12px, while the Y-axis labels are styled in green with a font size of 14px. The data series is named 'Temperature' and includes monthly temperature data. The line series uses a gradient color from light blue to dark blue. Additional configurations include setting the chart margins to 50px on all sides, positioning the legend at the bottom of the chart, and aligning it to the center.
